Title: Analyst, Insights & Reporting
Description:
About Sony Music Entertainment

At Sony Music Entertainment, we fuel the creative journey. We’ve played a pioneering role in music history, from the first-ever music label to the invention of the flat disc record. We’ve nurtured some of music’s most iconic artists and produced some of the most influential recordings of all time.

Today, we work in more than 70 countries, supporting a diverse roster of international superstars, developing and independent artists, and visionary creators. From our position at the intersection of music, entertainment, and technology, we bring imagination and expertise to the newest products and platforms, embrace new business models, employ breakthrough tools, and provide powerful insights that help our artists push creative boundaries and reach new audiences. In everything we do, we’re committed to artistic integrity, transparency, and entrepreneurship.

Sony Music Entertainment is a member of the Sony family of global companies.

The Analyst - Podcast provides insightful and strategic reporting to the Global Podcast Division across both the US + UK. This is a great opportunity for a data-savvy candidate to support Sony Music’s efforts in podcasting.

The role is responsible for leveraging a suite of internal and 3rd party tools to generate reporting and strategic insights across SME’s global podcast division. The role combines performance reporting, audience insights and ad hoc duties to drive data-driven decision making. The Analyst will generate data-driven recommendations for diverse set of teams spanning creative, marketing, ad sales + executive leadership, ultimately translating the actionable insights into presentation format. The candidate will be part of Sony Music’s podcast team in New York and will report into the VP, Insights & Reporting.

What you'll do:


Provide detailed weekly reports on show/episode performance, charting, + engagement metrics across the entire slate and key podcast titles to inform real-time decision making.
Generate insight around existing + future audiences for our podcasts, leveraging multiple data sources across analytics + research. This includes designing + analyzing listener surveys for direct feedback from core audiences.
Create deep-dive analyses or research studies to help refine audience targets, marketing, + ad sales, as well as evaluate future editorial decisions (e.g. talent conversations, creative concepts, etc).
Prepare regular mid or post campaign analyses for key titles, identifying areas of success and optimization across creative and marketing.
Respond to a large volume of ad-hoc data + analytics requests in a timely manner across multiple teams to support show marketing + sales efforts


Who you are:


Minimum 2-3 years experience in analytics, market/consumer research, media/entertainment research, audience development or related field
Possess a strong knowledge and passion for podcasts is a must.
Comfortable with various coding, survey research, visualization + data software programs/tools, such as Excel, PowerPoint, SQL, Python, Tableau, Looker social analytics platforms, survey design/analytics tools (e.g. Qualtrics, GWI, Brandwatch, Tubular, etc)
Know how to tell a compelling story from data in a clear + concise manner – orally, in writing, and in visual presentations.
Are an effective communicator, with excellent verbal + written communication skills
Have great organizational skills + are comfortable handling multiple projects simultaneously with efficiency & speed, working well under tight deadlines.
Degree with a concentration in Analytics / Psychology / Marketing / Consumer Behavior preferred (or equivalent work experience)


What we give you:


You join an inclusive, collaborative and global community where you have the opportunity to channel your passion every day
A modern office environment designed to foster productivity, creativity, and teamwork empowering you to bring your best
An attractive and comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life & disability coverage, and 401K + employer matching
Voluntary benefits like company-paid identity theft protection and resources for pets, mental health and meditation resources, industry-leading fertility coverage, fully paid leave for childbirth or bonding, fully paid leave for caregivers, programs for loved ones with developmental disabilities and neurodiversity, subsidized back-up child and elder care, and reimbursement for adoption, surrogacy, tuition, and student loans
Investment in your professional growth and development enabling you to thrive in our vibrant community.
The space to accelerate progress, positively disrupt, and create what happens next
Time off for a winter recess


Sony Music is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of age, disability, national origin, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, veteran or military status, marital and civil partnership/union status, alienage or citizenship status, creed, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

The anticipated annual base salary does not include any other compensation components or other benefits that an individual may be eligible for. The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job.

New York Pay Range

$64,000—$70,000 USD

Title: Data Analyst - Services
Description:
We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.

Lenovo is a US$57 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #248 in the Fortune Global 500, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver Smarter Technology for All, Lenovo has built on its success as the world’s largest PC company with a full-stack portfolio of AI-enabled, AI-ready, and AI-optimized devices (PCs, workstations, smartphones, tablets), infrastructure (server, storage, edge, high performance computing and software defined infrastructure), software, solutions, and services. Lenovo’s continued investment in world-changing innovation is building a more equitable, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. Lenovo is listed on the Hong Kong stock exchange under Lenovo Group Limited (HKSE: 992) (ADR: LNVGY).

This transformation together with Lenovo’s world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit www.lenovo.com, and read about the latest news via our StoryHub.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze call center metrics, remote service data ( Onsite and Depot), and customer experience feedback to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement
Design and implement dashboards to track KPIs for service delivery performance, customer satisfaction, and operational efficiency
Perform root cause analysis on service delivery issues to help teams address underlying problems
Generate regular reports on service performance metrics for leadership and operational teams
Collaborate with IT and service management teams to improve data quality and collection methods
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders


Required Qualifications


3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a service delivery or call center environment
Strong experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Proficiency in statistical analysis and data mining techniques
Experience analyzing customer satisfaction metrics and service level agreements
Demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with remote service delivery models and associated metrics
Familiarity with CRM systems and support ticketing platforms
Understanding of customer journey mapping and experience measurement
Experience with process improvement methodologies (Six Sigma, Lean)


What Success Looks Like


Deliver data-driven insights that measurably improve customer satisfaction scores
Create self-service analytics that enable teams to make informed decisions


Identify optimization opportunities that reduce costs while maintaining service quality

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Summary / Objective

The Associate Data Analyst will be responsible for conducting in-depth analytics to support merchandising, bidding, and search optimization initiatives. You will analyze data to provide insights that support the product team's growth strategy. This position will require you possess a strong foundation in Machine Learning (ML), Artificial Intelligence (AI), SQL, and big data services. An interest or background in bidding platforms, pricing strategies, or product merchandising is highly valued.




This role reports to the Director of Product Strategy.




What You'll Do

Conduct detailed analysis of data related to merchandising, bidding, and search
Utilize SQL and other tools to query and manipulate large datasets
Monitor and respond to changes in market trends to capitalize on growth opportunities
Implement recommended bidding strategies on domain registrar platforms
Apply ML and AI techniques to identify trends and patterns in data
Assist in the development of reports and dashboards to communicate insights to stakeholders
Support the Product Strategy team with ad-hoc data requests and analysis
Contribute to the improvement of data analysis processes and methodologies
Other duties as assigned




Who You Are / What You Bring

Entry-level to 2+ years of professional experience in a data analysis role
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or equivalent experience
Solid understanding of SQL and experience querying databases
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Familiarity with ML and AI concepts and techniques
Ability to work with and analyze large datasets ("big-data")
Interest in learning about bidding platforms, bidding strategies, and auction strategies
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to communicate technical findings to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to travel as needed
Ability to work across time zones as part of a global organization as needed
Reliable transportation to the workplace




Physical Requirements

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times




Salary Range

The U.S. base salary range for this full-time position is $73,000 - $93,000 (flexibility based on experience) plus benefits as described below. In addition, the successful candidate will be eligible to receive other compensation from time to time in the form of discretionary and/or nondiscretionary bonuses and long-term incentive plan. Actual compensation will be influenced by a candidate’s qualifications, internal employee equity considerations, and location. We will not ask for information about a candidate's current or past compensation for purposes of developing an offer of employment.




US team members (and their spouses, domestic partners, and/or dependent children) are covered by generously subsidized medical, dental, and vision insurance which includes company contributions to a Health Savings Accounts. Team members are also covered by company-paid life and disability insurance and have the option of participating in employee-paid supplemental life, accidental death and dismemberment, critical illness, and accident insurance. In addition, team members can enroll in the company's 401(k) plan with up to a 5% match. You receive 15 days of paid vacation yearly, increasing to 20 days after one year. Additionally, you get 5 days of paid sick leave, 13 paid holidays, and 20 weeks of paid parental leave for birthing parents, 12 weeks for others. Also, there's an opportunity for tuition reimbursement for qualifying expenses.




Note: Benefits programs are subject to eligibility requirements and may vary in certain locations.




A Few Things To Know About Us

Identity Digital is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or any other category prohibited by local, state or federal law. This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including recruitment, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, social and recreational activities, and termination.




Background Check Statement

At the time of an offer, you will be required to complete a background check. Any offer is contingent upon a satisfactory background check.




Sponsorship Statement

Please note that work sponsorship for this position may not be available now or in the future. While we strive to support our candidates, not all roles will qualify. Eligibility will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.




Accommodation Statement

We are committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Identity Digital will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact our Recruiting Team at careers@identity.digital.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

At Olio, our core focus is to make healthcare clinicians’ lives simpler and more productive by creating software that connects siloed clinical teams. We’re proud of the fact that our customers love our product and that our work has a measurable positive impact on the lives of their patients. We’re growing fast and looking to add a Data Analyst to our team.




What We’re Looking For

The Analytics team collaborates cross-functionally with Engineering, Product, Customer Success, Growth, and Product Support to facilitate a data-driven culture. This team’s mission is to inspire action by providing the data, tools, and analysis to all relevant stakeholders. To bridge the gap between technical and business perspectives, this individual will be detail-oriented, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and think critically to solve problems. Expertise in data modeling and transformation, data visualization, project management, and written/verbal storytelling is critical.




What We Provide

A high-performing team. We set ambitious but reasonable goals and work together to make sure we achieve them. Delivering consistent, high-quality products to our users is our number one priority.

A supportive environment. We value open communication and make efforts to practice consistently giving and receiving feedback. We welcome diverse ideas and seek input from all team members.

Room to grow. We believe strongly in investing in our people. Opportunities for learning and development abound through design discussions, support for continued learning, one on one meetings with leadership, and more.




Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
3-5 years of relevant experience in data analysis, SaaS or technology preferred
Advanced SQL proficiency with complex querying, optimization, and transformation
Demonstrated understanding of relational databases and managing schema changes
Strong oral and written communication skills to translate data into insights
Desire to work closely with stakeholders to bring maximum value through data analytics




Preferred Qualifications

Professional certifications in analytics or cloud platforms (Tableau, AWS, Snowflake, dbt)
Proficient in Python and/or R programming for data manipulation and statistical analysis
Industry-specific knowledge of SaaS metrics and business models




Job Requirements

Perform complex data modeling and transformation to generate actionable business insights
Own product analytics reporting to answer all questions related to the utilization and impact of current and emerging product features
Innovate, enhance, and own standardized reporting tools measuring performance across the post-acute care continuum
Contribute to the process optimization and workflow improvement of the Analytics Department
Continuously evolve Olio’s suite of analytical offerings by democratizing data access and improving self-service capabilities
Contextualize results and present effective data visualizations to internal and external stakeholders
Mentor and support junior analysts and business users in developing analytical skills
Serve as a subject matter expert regarding all things product analytics, statistical measurement, process reporting, and analytical resources




Benefits and Compensation

Competitive salary
Significant opportunities for career advancement
Flexible schedule and vacation policy
Parental leave for birthing / non-birthing parents
Convenient, modern office location
Health/dental/vision insurance
STD/LTD/Life coverage
401k
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Employment Type: Full-Time, Direct Hire

Location: New York, NY (Hybrid)

Overview

We are looking for an analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our data team supporting high-impact financial operations. This role is geared toward individuals with a strong foundation in analytics and data manipulation, particularly in environments such as private equity, hedge funds, fintech, or investment banking. The ideal candidate will bring technical proficiency, financial insight, and a passion for uncovering actionable insights from complex datasets.

Key Responsibilities

Analyze large-scale financial datasets to uncover patterns, trends, and opportunities
Design and execute data workflows for modeling, forecasting, and operational reporting
Build and maintain dashboards and reporting tools using Power BI and advanced Excel (including macros and VLOOKUP)
Write and optimize queries in SQL and develop scripts in Python to support analytical initiatives
Collaborate with business teams to define data requirements and deliver insights for decision-making
Support machine learning and predictive modeling projects aimed at strategic investment and financial planning
Ensure data integrity and compliance with quality standards in a cloud-driven environment

Required Qualifications

3–5 years of experience in data analysis roles, ideally in financial services
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Excel with advanced functions (macros, VLOOKUP, pivot tables)
Experience using Power BI or similar data visualization tools
Strong understanding of data manipulation, data modeling, and analytics workflows
Ability to translate complex datasets into clear business insights
Familiarity with ML and predictive modeling techniques for financial applications

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Finance, or a related field
Prior experience in high-growth fintech, hedge funds, or investment banking analytics teams
Certification in SQL development, BI tools, or Python programming is a plus

Work Environment

Hybrid work structure with onsite presence in New York, NY
Fast-paced, data-driven culture combining technology innovation with financial strategy

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What We Do:  

Brightwell is a pioneering payments company dedicated to providing innovative solutions and technology for global money transfers while navigating the intricate landscape of regulatory requirements. Through strategic partnerships and technological advancements, Brightwell facilitates cross-border payments, offering a range of options including bank transfers, mobile wallets, and cash transactions. With a focus on unparalleled fraud detection and transaction monitoring supported by a team of global payment experts, Brightwell empowers businesses and individuals to seamlessly manage and move money worldwide. 

Who We Need:  

We’re searching for a Data Analyst to join the team. As our ideal Data Analyst, you will work with data sets, develop reports, and communicate insights. You'll be responsible for creating, monitoring, and building dashboards, models, and ad hoc analyses to support product efforts. As a Data Analyst, you will extract data from multiple sources with ease and work with various teams to help meet their data needs. Grasping and deciphering complex data while leveraging your analytical skills to create actionable insights will be a key part of this role.  

This is a hybrid role, working 2 days/week in our office based in the Smyrna/Vinings area of Atlanta. 

Your day-to-day: 

Collect, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources for analysis. 
Analyze data using statistical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and correlations. 
Collaborate with cross functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. 
Develop and automate custom reports and dashboards to help understand product usage and client behavior. 
Develop and maintain data models, ensuring data integrity and accuracy. 
Identify opportunities for process improvement and propose data-driven solutions. 
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support business initiatives and answer specific questions. 
Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and reporting. 
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and security protocols. 
Other tasks, as assigned. 

As a Data Analyst, you bring the following skills: 

Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, or a related field. A Master’s degree is a plus. 
Proficiency in SQL and data querying languages. 
Advanced skills in Power BI: 
Building comprehensive reports and dashboards. 
Data modeling and DAX (Data Analysis Expressions). 
Creating interactive visualizations and reports. 
Using Power Query for data transformation. 
Integrating Power BI with various data sources. 
Knowledge of Power BI Service for sharing and collaboration. 
Experience with Azure Data Factory (ADF): Designing and implementing data pipelines for ETL processes a plus.  
Experience with other data visualization tools such as Tableau is a plus. 
Excellence in data analysis: Translating insights into business strategies. 
Advanced Excel skills: Pivot tables, macros, etc. 
Quantitative problem-solving: Enthusiasm for solving problems using data. 
Experience with secure data: Adhering to secure data practices. 

What We’re Offering in Return   

Empowered Work: Own your work and grow your career with real autonomy.  
Flex Friendly Culture: Enjoy flexibility with support for remote work and periodic team meetups.  
Startup Energy, Global Impact: Join a passionate team building mission-critical tools for people around the world.  
Great Benefits: Medical, dental, vision, disability, 401(k), paid parental leave, PTO, and more.  
Supportive Environment: Thrive in a collaborative, inclusive workplace that values innovation and continuous learning. 

Brightwell is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) committed to employing a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture.

Description:
The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities
Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data
Compile and analyze data related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion




Qualifications

1 - 2 years' Data Analysis experience

Title: Data Analyst - East Coast
Description:
At Dario, Every Day is a New Opportunity to Make a Difference.

﻿We are on a mission to make better health easy. Every day our employees contribute to this mission and help hundreds of thousands of people around the globe improve their health. How cool is that? We are looking for passionate, smart, and collaborative people who have a desire to do something meaningful and impactful in their career.

We’re looking for a talented Data Analyst who will help move the needle for the entire company by doing high-quality work in terms of answering tough questions, improving our decision-making, and surfacing insights we didn’t know before.

The perfect candidate will provide data-driven insights and recommendations to drive strategic decisions across business and product, become the focal point for all related data matters in the organization, See beyond numbers and help to inform, influence, support, and execute our decisions and strategy.

Responsibilities:


Create real value from data and communicate it to the various stakeholders; Work closely with Marketing, Product etc.
Analyze internal and external data sources to reach actionable recommendations for business decisions.
Design and create BI ETL’s, reports, and dashboards that will provide insights about the product and business performance.
Design and develop data visualization (Tableau)


Requirements:


2–3 years of experience as a BI Analyst, Product Analyst, Business Analyst, or Data Analyst. Experience in the health industry is a strong advantage.
Bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) is required; a degree in Economics or Business Administration is preferred.
Proficient in SQL
Expert at Data Visualizations (preferably Tableau)
Great at communicating results of the analysis in simple business language
Team player, effective interpersonal skills, and good vibes. Manage relationships with key partners across different functions.


Advantages:


Experience working in the Health industry
Statistical knowledge and experience using statistics to analyze datasets
Coding/scripting experience with Python


***DarioHealth promotes diversity of thought, culture and background, which connects the entire Dario team. We believe that every member on our team enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and to discover, design and deliver solutions. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable working and learning environments for all people, and do not discriminate against any employee or job candidate. ***

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:




Jackson Healthcare is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our growing information technology team! In this position you’ll perform extensive quantitative and qualitative analysis to support business decision-making across the organization. The creation and use of reports and dashboards delivered through the Microsoft Power BI platform and ancillary tools will be central to providing insights to business partners. The ability to work collaboratively and communicate effectively is critical to the success of this role.




THIS ROLE IS HYBRID AND REQUIRES RESIDING IN THE ATLANTA AREA. No relocation assistance will be provided with any offer.




ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:




Collaborate frequently with business partners to understand their business processes and identify opportunities to drive better decision-making through data & analytic solutions
Gain familiarity with the data underlying Workday, Salesforce, ServiceNow, M365 and other platforms in use across the organization to draw out actionable insights
Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis around various business subject matters, and provide data driven and actionable insights through the creation of reports and data visualizations to facilitate business decision making
Design, develop, test, and support both standard and ad hoc reports and dashboards as requested by business partners
Ensure reports, dashboards and data feeds are secured and follow data governance and security policies
Analyze and interpret results using standard statistical tools and techniques
Develop templates and branding to deliver a consistent and intuitive end-user experience for analytic solutions




QUALIFICATIONS – EDUCATION, WORK EXPERIENCE, CERTIFICATIONS:




3-5 years of experience in an analytical role
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Information Technology, or related field or equivalent work experience required
Self-motivated with the ability to define, structure, and prioritize work




KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:




Expertise in building and deploying reports and dashboards in Microsoft Power BI
Familiarity with dimensional database models
Proficient with data visualizations and data storytelling to drive insights and decision-making
Expertise in Microsoft Excel
Excellent communication skills
Experience in mapping business processes and recommending changes to better align with analytical needs
Experience with one or more of the following business platforms preferred: Workday, Salesforce, ServiceNow
Experience in analytics for Human Resources, Insurance, or Medical Billing a plus

HTML:
POSITION SUMMARY:


Jackson Healthcare is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our growing information technology team! In this position you’ll perform extensive quantitative and qualitative analysis to support business decision-making across the organization. The creation and use of reports and dashboards delivered through the Microsoft Power BI platform and ancillary tools will be central to providing insights to business partners. The ability to work collaboratively and communicate effectively is critical to the success of this role.


THIS ROLE IS HYBRID AND REQUIRES RESIDING IN THE ATLANTA AREA. No relocation assistance will be provided with any offer.


ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Collaborate frequently with business partners to understand their business processes and identify opportunities to drive better decision-making through data & analytic solutions
  • Gain familiarity with the data underlying Workday, Salesforce, ServiceNow, M365 and other platforms in use across the organization to draw out actionable insights
  • Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis around various business subject matters, and provide data driven and actionable insights through the creation of reports and data visualizations to facilitate business decision making
  • Design, develop, test, and support both standard and ad hoc reports and dashboards as requested by business partners
  • Ensure reports, dashboards and data feeds are secured and follow data governance and security policies
  • Analyze and interpret results using standard statistical tools and techniques
  • Develop templates and branding to deliver a consistent and intuitive end-user experience for analytic solutions


QUALIFICATIONS – EDUCATION, WORK EXPERIENCE, CERTIFICATIONS:


  • 3-5 years of experience in an analytical role
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Information Technology, or related field or equivalent work experience required
  • Self-motivated with the ability to define, structure, and prioritize work


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:


  • Expertise in building and deploying reports and dashboards in Microsoft Power BI
  • Familiarity with dimensional database models
  • Proficient with data visualizations and data storytelling to drive insights and decision-making
  • Expertise in Microsoft Excel
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Experience in mapping business processes and recommending changes to better align with analytical needs
  • Experience with one or more of the following business platforms preferred: Workday, Salesforce, ServiceNow
  • Experience in analytics for Human Resources, Insurance, or Medical Billing a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for a detail-oriented Data Analyst who will be working across the business to shape data models, cleanse and transform datasets, and support strategic decision-making through intuitive dashboards and visualizations.




What You'll Be Doing:

Building and maintaining data models to support reporting and analytics.
Cleaning, transforming, and validating raw data from multiple sources.
Creating dashboards and reports using BI tools.
Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data needs and priorities.
Supporting internal teams with ad hoc data requests and insights.
Laying the groundwork to eventually support more advanced statistical or machine learning projects.




What We're Looking For:

1–3 years of experience in a data analysis or similar role.
Experience using BI tools – Sisense is ideal, but Power BI, Tableau, Sigma, or ThoughtSpot are also helpful.
Solid SQL skills and confidence working with relational databases.
A logical approach to data transformation and wrangling.
Comfortable discussing data requirements and presenting findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Ambition to progress within the data function.




Nice-to-Haves:

Experience with Python or R (even just the basics).
Understanding of statistics or a background in maths, engineering, or computer science.
Exposure to cloud data platforms (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift).

Title: Data & Visualization Analyst
Description:
Data & Visualization Analyst (Remote) at UCT




Drive Semiconductor Innovation with Data at UCT

UCT harnesses data to fuel strategic decisions and innovation in semiconductor manufacturing. We seek a remote Data & Visualization Analyst with unmatched expertise to deliver high-impact analytics. Only masters of these skills need apply!




Key Responsibilities:

Lead data projects from requirements to actionable insights.
Build advanced Power BI dashboards with DAX/Power Query.
Integrate datasets using SAP BW for seamless reporting.
Optimize pipelines with SQL, Python, and cloud platforms.
Design scalable data models and define KPIs.
Ensure data quality in Agile workflows.

Required Skills (This Combination, Advanced & Expert-Level):

SAP BW: Mastery in data integration/reporting.
Power BI with DAX/Power Query: Mastery in visualizations.
Independent Report Creation: Expert in autonomous reporting.
SQL/Python: Expert in querying/scripting.
Data Modeling: Advanced in schema design.
Databricks: Expert in cloud processing (AWS/Azure with trainability accepted).
Thank you, only this order of skill(s) will be reviewed. or less-than-expert proficiency accepted.

Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor’s/master’s in computer science, IT, or related field.
Experience: 3-6 years in data analytics/BI, ideally in semiconductor/high-tech industries.
Certifications: SAP BW/BO, Power BI, or Databricks preferred.
Skills: Superior analytical and communication skills. Agile experience a plus.

Work Environment:

Fully remote, supporting UCT’s semiconductor mission.
Minimal demands: prolonged sitting, occasional standing. Accessibility accommodations provided.

Apply: Submit resume via [michael.halsey@uct.com] .

#DataAnalytics #Semiconductor #RemoteJobs

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

The Strategy Data Analyst will support the LANEIGE brand team by delivering data-driven insights across key strategic areas including product performance, consumer behavior, and market trends. This role will work closely with cross-functional teams such as Brand Marketing, E-commerce, and Global HQ to inform decision-making and optimize brand growth.




Key Responsibilities




Business Strategy & Performance Analysis

Collaborate with Demand Planning and Sales Account Leads to consolidate inputs and align with monthly net sales targets, contributing to accurate performance tracking and strategic planning.
Collaborate with the Marketing team to manage SKU lists and regularly share updates with relevant departments to ensure alignment and operational efficiency
Manage and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) on a monthly basis using sales and operational data; communicate findings with relevant departments and HQ.
Conduct weekly/monthly sales performance analysis(Sell-thru, Sell-in) and share insights with brand teams and stakeholders, including HQ counterparts.
Generate diversified insights through regular data analysis to support business growth and strategic planning.
Track and report monthly P&L metrics, identifying issues and escalating them to management with actionable recommendations.




Market Intelligence

Conduct periodic and ad-hoc market research to identify key trends in the US market and propose strategic actions for brands (LANEIGE, INNISFREE, HANYUL)
Collaborate with the CMI team and Amazon Team to manage and analyze market data from third-party sources (e.g., Circana, Profitero)
Support brand and corporate teams with consumer and competitive intelligence to enhance market positioning
Work closely with the Brands(LANEIGE, INNISFREE, HANYUL) Marketing team to provide necessary analytical data and support data-driven decision-making(e.g., category, retailer)




Global Corporate Strategy Development

Support new business development initiatives across North and Latin America (e.g., new markets, new channels) by coordinating with internal and external stakeholders.
Review and summarize key HQ documents written in Korean, and share relevant insights with team members and leadership
Ensure alignment between HQ’s global strategic direction and APUS’s local strategies through effective communication and data-driven insights.
Assist in the development of short- and long-term business plans by providing relevant data analysis and scenario modeling.
Provide analytical support for regular HQ meetings (weekly/monthly) and key strategic discussions.




Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, business strategy, or a related role (experience in beauty industry is a plus).
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools (e.g., SAP, Power BI) are a strong plus.
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills in English & Korean
Ability to work cross-functionally and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.




Company Benefits

Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
HSA Employer Contributions and FSA Options
401k Participation with company matching.
Discount on all APUS Brands Products
Gratis Program - Gift box with top selling products, twice a year
Paid Maternity Leave
Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance
Paid Time Off: Vacation / Personal days / Sick days
Company offered Mental Counseling for all employees
Office-closed holidays and floating holidays
Company sponsored events
Education assistant Program
Employee Referral Program







AMOREPACIFIC, US, INC is an equal opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We actively seek to maintain a diverse work force, and AMOREPACIFIC US, INC therefore recruits qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, or Vietnam veteran status.

Title: Data Analyst 2
Description:
The Company
PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.

We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.

We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.

Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.

Job Description Summary:
We are looking for Senior Data Analyst with experience in managing new payment product launch as well as payment risk management for the Large Enterprise (LE) portfolio. This position resides in the Global Fraud Prevention organization that supports various business lines in optimizing risk and revenue to enable profitable business growth within risk appetite. This role combines strategy, analytics, operational practices, and business insights into one. Day-to-day duties include data analysis, monitoring and forecasting, creating the logic and implementing risk rules and strategies, providing requirements to data science and technology teams on attribute, model and platform requirements, and communicating with global stakeholders to ensure we deliver the best possible customer experience while meeting loss rate targets. The work is fast paced and intellectually challenged to solve complex business problems.

Job Description:
Scope of Responsibility:


Design, develop and maintain data driven solutions for LE risk management. Makes sound decisions that balance risk, user experience and financial performance
Develop and automate tracking functionality that monitors volume and solution efficacy
Partner with Product and Business Unit organization to meet Product launch roadmap deadlines as well as rising roadblocks
Presentation to senior management within Risk and Business Unit, even external Partners on core strategy changes, integration requirement or risk management best practice
Managing conversion rate, loss target and customer experience
Job Requirements:
Strong analytical skills with hands on experience on predicative modeling, data mining, as well as analyzing large, multi-dimensional data sets
Fluent in SQL/ R / Python/ Notebooks/ Teradata or other relational database languages is a must
Experience with one or multiple following will be highly desirable: Jupyter, Hadoop/Hive, BigQuery
Polished communication and influence skills to collaborate with cross functional teams. Presenting in a clear and concise manner and reach alignment on how to execute risk strategies
“Can-do” attitude, energetic personality, ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment to meet deadlines
Must handle multiple priorities with a strong attention to detail and should possess strong analytic and problem solving skills
Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills
Bachelor’s Degree or above in one of the following: economics, computer science, engineering, statistics, etc.
Experience in Fintech/Payment industry/Risk Management a strong plus



For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.

Our Benefits:

At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.

We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com

Who We Are:

To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx

Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.

Belonging at PayPal:

Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.

Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.

REQ ID R0127437

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

🏢 Company: Aaratech Inc

🛑 Eligibility: Only U.S. Citizens and Green Card holders are eligible.

Please note that we do not offer visa sponsorship.

Job Summary:

Aaratech Inc. is seeking a highly analytical and detail-driven Data Analyst to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that influence strategic decisions and improve operational performance. If you enjoy working with large data sets, creating impactful visualizations, and collaborating across departments, we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities:

🔹 Data Collection & Management

Gather, clean, and organize data from various internal and external sources.
Ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity of datasets.

🔹 Data Analysis

Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Support decision-making through statistical analysis and forecasting.

🔹 Reporting & Visualization

Design and build dashboards and reports using Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Present data-driven findings in a clear, concise manner to stakeholders.

🔹 Team Collaboration

Work with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored analytics solutions.

🔹 Tool Utilization

Leverage tools like SQL, Excel, and BI platforms for analysis and reporting.

🔹 Data Governance

Contribute to the implementation of data governance and best practices for long-term data integrity.

Qualifications:

✅ Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field

✅ Minimum of 2 years of experience in a data analysis or similar role

✅ Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel

✅ Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI

✅ Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking abilities

✅ Excellent written and verbal communication skills

✅ Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

Title: Data Analyst, Loss Forecasting, Budgeting & Automation
Description:
About The Role

We are hiring a Risk Analyst who is data-driven and has strong analytical & technical skills. In this role, you will work on the fraud risk team and will play a key role in loss forecasting, improving existing processes through automation and optimizing loss rates on the existing portfolio. You’ll work closely with product, engineering, data analytics, accounting, auditing and finance teams, interacting with key stakeholders across many departments.

Your goals include empathizing with customer pain points and improving the overall experience, while also protecting the platform from exploitation by bad actors. You will be responsible for forecasting fraud losses based on historical data, and continuously striving to create a fraud-free, frictionless experience for our members.

The base salary offered for this role and level of experience will begin at $112,140.00 and up to $155,800.00. Full-time employees are also eligible for a bonus, competitive equity package, and benefits. The actual base salary offered may be higher, depending on your location, skills, qualifications, and experience.

In this role, you can expect to


Proactively, and in response to loss events, explore data to identify opportunities to reduce losses with minimal impact to member experience (35%)
Improve existing processes in dispute and fraud management to enhance efficiency and reduce manual interventions (35%)
Develop and maintain actionable dashboards and reports to track Risk performance against defined loss and member success metrics (10%)
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to fulfill ad-hoc requirements as needed (10%)
Support fraud loss forecasting to meet accounting and finance requirements (10%)


To thrive in this role, you have


1+ years of experience in a Fraud, Compliance, Risk, or Investigations role.
1+ years of analytical experience, preferably at a FinTech company.
Excellent SQL
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills.
Experience in Python preferred
Knowledge of the fundamentals of payment processing and an understanding of industry risk trends, including familiarity with risk strategy development
Exceptional detail-orientation and organizational skills. You are eager to solve challenging analytical problems for our members
Comfortable leveraging AI tools and techniques to enhance productivity, including automating repetitive tasks, streamlining data workflows, and generating insights efficiently. A growth mindset and willingness to experiment with emerging technologies are highly valued
The drive to work in a fast-paced environment and exceed ambitions deadlines while ensuring flawless completion
Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitatively rigorous discipline like engineering, statistics, math, or economics is preferred
A passion for Chime’s mission


A Little About Us

At Chime, we believe that everyone can achieve financial progress. We created Chime—a financial technology company, not a bank*— on the premise that core banking services should be helpful, easy, and free. Through our user-friendly tools and intuitive platforms, we empower our members to take control of their finances and work towards their goals. Whether it's starting a savings account, purchasing a first car or home, launching a business, or pursuing higher education, we're proud to have helped millions unlock their financial potential.

We're a team of problem solvers, dreamers, and builders with one shared obsession: our members. From day one, Chimers have worked tirelessly to out-hustle and out-execute competitors to bring our mission to life. Their grit and determination inspire us to work harder every day to deliver the very best experience possible. We each bring an owner's mindset to our work, refusing to be outdone and holding ourselves accountable to meet and exceed the highest bars for our teams, our company, and our members.

We believe in being bold, dreaming big, and taking risks, while also working together, embracing our diverse perspectives, and giving each other honest feedback. Our culture remains deeply entrepreneurial, encouraging every Chimer to see themselves as stewards of our mission to help everyday Americans unlock their financial progress.

We know that to achieve our mission, we must earn and keep people's trust—so we hold ourselves to the highest standards of integrity in everything we do. These aren't just words on a wall—our values are embedded in every aspect of our business, serving as a north star that guides us as we work to help millions achieve their financial potential.

Because if we don't—who will?


Chime is a financial technology company, not a bank. Banking services provided by The Bancorp Bank, N.A. or Stride Bank, N.A., Members FDIC.


What We Offer


🏢 A thoughtful hybrid work policy that combines in-office days and trips to team and company-wide events depending on location to ensure you stay connected to your work and teammates, whether you’re local to one of our offices or remote
💻 Hybrid work perks like backup child, elder and/or pet care, as well as a subsidized commuter benefit
💰 Competitive salary based on experience
✨ 401k match plus great medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits
🏝 Generous vacation policy and company-wide Chime Days, bonus company-wide paid days off
🫂 1% of your time off to support local community organizations of your choice
👟 Annual wellness stipend to use towards eligible wellness related expenses
👶 Up to 24 weeks of paid parental leave for birthing parents and 12 weeks of paid parental leave for non-birthing parents
👪 Access to Maven, a family planning tool, with $15k lifetime reimbursement for egg freezing, fertility treatments, adoption, and more.
🎉 In-person and virtual events to connect with your fellow Chimers—think cooking classes, guided meditations, music festivals, mixology classes, paint nights, etc., and delicious snack boxes, too!
💚 A challenging and fulfilling opportunity to join one of the most experienced teams in FinTech and help millions unlock financial progress


We know that great work can’t be done without a diverse team and inclusive environment. That’s why we specifically look for individuals of varying strengths, skills, backgrounds, and ideas to join our team. We believe this gives us a competitive advantage to better serve our members and helps us all grow as Chimers and individuals.

We hire candidates of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital or family status, disability, Veteran status, and any other status. Chime is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Cook County Ordinance, and consistent with Canadian provincial and federal laws. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

To learn more about how Chime collects and uses your personal information during the application process, please see the Chime Applicant Privacy Notice.

Title: Analyst, Consumer Insights
Description:
The Analyst of Consumer Insights will deliver exceptional support to the Consumer Insights team within Brand Marketing at Red Bull North America. This position will play a crucial role in representing the voice of the consumer, identifying growth opportunities, and contributing to marketing insights and strategies across the U.S. market.




All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:




SUPPORT THE OPTIMIZATION OF CONSUMER DATA AND INSIGHTS

Assist in the creation of reports and materials using diverse sources of consumer data to support overall business objectives within the Marketing organization, while exhibiting a sense of urgency, persistence, and dedication to quality and customer service.
Independently and proactively analyze consumer data from key resources to address ongoing and ad hoc business inquiries, contributing to marketing strategies and a deeper understanding of the Energy Drinks category.
Contribute to the development and presentation of regular consumer insights materials, including analyses of consumer trends, demographics, and behaviors, to generate insights and uncover opportunities.




CONSUMER RESEARCH SUPPORT

Assist senior team members in identifying knowledge gaps and collaborate with vendor partners to execute quantitative and qualitative research projects aimed at addressing those gaps.
Improve the effectiveness of existing and syndicated consumer studies, integrating them with other data sources to develop impactful, actionable insights materials.
Support the administration of custom research initiatives to enhance strategic marketing decisions.
Provide assistance across the organization to promote the adoption of insights and ensure mastery of the related content.




COMMUNICATION AND REPORTING

Support the delivery of both regular and ad hoc Consumer Insights materials and resources to provide the organization with a comprehensive understanding of consumers and actionable insights to drive growth and support Red Bull's strategic initiatives.
Establish best practices for reporting and take responsibility for updating materials, which will be organized into an Insights library.
Regularly communicate insights across all levels of the organization through reports, newsletters, and internal presentations.




Your areas of knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative or business-related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Business Analytics)
Minimum 2+ years of experience in marketing analytics, customer insights, or a similar role in a consumer-facing environment
Expert proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially PowerPoint and Excel
Proficiency in SPSS and experience navigating crosstab tools
Experience with Power BI/Tableau or other data analysis/visualization software
Ability to support quantitative and qualitative research methodologies
Strength in creating fact-based stories, and the ability to integrate multiple tools to solve problems
Ability to analyze results, interpret findings, support recommendations, and develop presentations
Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to present and explain complex technical information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others, and gains understanding
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with CPG brands and related data and knowledge of research methodologies preferred




This position is open to U.S. citizens, U.S. permanent residents, or individuals who are currently authorized to work in the United States on a valid visa.




The base salary range for this position is $65,600 - $98,400 + cash incentives. Actual salary offers may vary based on work experience. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified.




Our current Benefits include:

Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision Plans, 401k Match, Family Leave, PTO & Paid Holiday Schedule, Pet, Legal, and Life Insurance, Tuition Reimbursement (Benefits listed may vary depending on the nature of your employment and/or work location)

Red Bull North America, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, or any other classification protected by Federal, state, or local law. We will consider for employment all qualified Applicants, including those with Criminal Histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
Core Responsibilities

Collaborate with engineering and operations SMEs across the organization to identify, ingest, and operationalize data sets for reliability analysis.
Analyze data to develop health metrics and identify top detractors to reliability; iterate on findings to validate hypotheses and refine insights.
Build compelling narratives around improvement opportunities and partner with cross-functional teams to workshop and implement solutions (e.g., fixes, workarounds).
Monitor the impact of deployed solutions and continuously evolve analytical methods to support ongoing reliability improvements.
Prepare executive-level communications, including dashboards, presentations, and progress reports that highlight key wins and customer impact.

Data Analysis & Metrics

Perform in-depth analysis to uncover trends and drivers of reliability within the program scope.
Create meaningful visualizations and comparisons using tools like Excel, SQL, Tableau, and ELK stack.
Understand end-to-end metrics, including data pipelines, dependencies, and service-level indicators.
Support ad hoc analysis requests from senior managers and technical working groups.

Stakeholder Engagement

Coordinate with cross-functional teams across TPX, Video and Entertainment Platforms, RDK Engineering, Network Engineering, CX, and Field Operations.
Provide consultative support to business and field teams to improve processes and customer experience.





You’ll thrive in this role if you bring:

A strong educational foundation and eagerness to learn our client's technology landscape.
Intellectual curiosity and a proactive approach to learning and problem-solving.
Proficiency in data tools (Excel, SQL, Tableau, ELK), strong communication skills, and the ability to create clear, executive-ready presentations.
A collaborative mindset, positive attitude, and persistence in overcoming challenges.
A consistent focus on enhancing reliability and delivering a better customer experience.

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
2+ years of experience with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
Experience in data analytics and familiarity with SQL or other query languages.





Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®



Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.





Robert Half works to put you in the best position to succeed. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity - whenever you choose - even on the go. Download the Robert Half app and get 1-tap apply, notifications of AI-matched jobs, and much more.





All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit roberthalf.gobenefits.net for more information.





© 2025 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to Robert Half’s Terms of Use.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Business Data Analyst

Location: Chicago, IL (Hybrid)

Salary Range: $90–$115K + bonus

Benefits: Medical, dental & vision insurance; 401(k) with matching; wellness programs




Responsibilities:

Build a comprehensive understanding of firm-wide operational data, including service usage, billing, infrastructure, and internal metadata
Reconcile vendor invoices against internal data inputs; identify discrepancies between contract terms and vendor billings
Own key vendor and service-level reporting—create data-driven validation tools and improve reporting accuracy
Partner cross-functionally to manage and update internal source data and ensure regulatory compliance
Define and implement best practices for data warehousing, quality control, and system enhancements
Contribute to process improvement efforts, including automation, audit support, and vendor performance tracking




Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Business Analytics
2+ years in a data- or finance-analytical role, preferably in trading, financial services, or technology
Hands-on experience with Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Strong grasp of reconciliations, audit protocols, and process improvement

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Profile

At Sand Cherry Associates, we excel in the design and delivery of strategic customer-centric initiatives through digitally-native, data-empowered solutions. Our client's confidence in us is centered on exceptionally skilled, high-energy talent working with the support of the full Sand Cherry team. Finding the right match for this role is a critical aspect of continuing that success.

Overview

We currently are looking to add a Data Analyst to the team. This position will support a product team with various data analysis and reporting tasks. They will also help manage projects, relationships and prioritization with product owners across the organization. This role will be required to utilize SQL within an AWS environment and may be work with external sources, including other databases, manual files, and external websites. You may also be tasked to analyze data and reports to monitor trends, product and feature launches and work with product owners to identify areas of improvement through data and reporting. Position will also assist in investigating issues with operations teams identifying metrics and KPIs to foster improvements our products and services.

Duties & Responsibilities


Performing data collection, as well as the identification, processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data from a myriad of sources
Work seamlessly within cross functional teams, gathering detailed reporting requirements for projects and ad-hoc requests
Executing data extraction including script writing for data mining and analytics
Building of scalable, flexible data models
Conducting ad-hoc analyses and presenting results in a clear manner
Creating insightful data visualizations and compelling data views
Present information and findings to their manager and or directly up to executive leadership
Familiarity working in large, enterprise environment with many cross functional teams
Communicating with stakeholders in a professional, succinct manner
Detail-oriented, well-organized, and an ability to work independently


Requirements

Desired Skills and Experience


Familiarity and experience within the Internet/ WiFi technologies and or Telecom domain a plus
Proficient in SQL / AWS Athena environment including the ability to write complex SQL queries, table joins and common table expressions (CTE)
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including formulas, pivot tables, and data analysis features
Proficiency in statistical methods, including hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and probability, to draw meaningful conclusions from data. Can identify important metrics and KPIs related for business and or WiFi technology performance
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python and R for statistical and data analysis a plus
Proficient with project lifecycles - Participates in projects from inception to end, working with project stakeholders to write detailed reporting requirements and deliver on reporting milestones during the project lifecycle
Proficient with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, Pivot or other reporting/visualization tools
Familiarity with Atlassian tools such as Jira and Confluence


Soft Skills:


Ability to work individually and in both small and large group settings which may include working cross functionally across the organization
Strong communication and presentation skills are necessary as we work closely with product owners and executive leadership
Strong organizational and time management skills required with ability to set prioritization and multitask to complete tasks on time


Education/Certifications


Bachelor's degree or commensurate experience necessary


Compensation

For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in Colorado, Sand Cherry Associates is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to the State of Colorado and takes into account a wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and delivery model. This is a 6 month consulting engagement, with an hourly range of $55-60/hour on 1099. Years of experience, level of education, geographic location, unique skills/qualifications for the specific role and potential certifications can be key factors in the final compensation for this role.

Benefits

Our team is unique — we are passionate about what we do. At Sand Cherry, our Consultants know they are impacting and shaping our clients' industries. We recognize our employees for their contributions. Our culture is one of the most friendly and communicative in the consulting industry. Sand Cherry is not a top-heavy organization. We offer the opportunity to be part of a digital workforce. Discover the experience that only comes with self-responsibility in the workplace. Our team members manage their own workloads and are expected to deliver exceptional work for our clients. Professional career growth is one of our main priorities, as we affirm that investing in our Consultants and empowering our people will also deliver the best results and value for our clients.

HTML:
Company Profile

At Sand Cherry Associates, we excel in the design and delivery of strategic customer-centric initiatives through digitally-native, data-empowered solutions. Our client's confidence in us is centered on exceptionally skilled, high-energy talent working with the support of the full Sand Cherry team. Finding the right match for this role is a critical aspect of continuing that success.

Overview

We currently are looking to add a Data Analyst to the team. This position will support a product team with various data analysis and reporting tasks. They will also help manage projects, relationships and prioritization with product owners across the organization. This role will be required to utilize SQL within an AWS environment and may be work with external sources, including other databases, manual files, and external websites. You may also be tasked to analyze data and reports to monitor trends, product and feature launches and work with product owners to identify areas of improvement through data and reporting. Position will also assist in investigating issues with operations teams identifying metrics and KPIs to foster improvements our products and services.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Performing data collection, as well as the identification, processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data from a myriad of sources
  • Work seamlessly within cross functional teams, gathering detailed reporting requirements for projects and ad-hoc requests
  • Executing data extraction including script writing for data mining and analytics
  • Building of scalable, flexible data models
  • Conducting ad-hoc analyses and presenting results in a clear manner
  • Creating insightful data visualizations and compelling data views
  • Present information and findings to their manager and or directly up to executive leadership
  • Familiarity working in large, enterprise environment with many cross functional teams
  • Communicating with stakeholders in a professional, succinct manner
  • Detail-oriented, well-organized, and an ability to work independently

Requirements

Desired Skills and Experience

  • Familiarity and experience within the Internet/ WiFi technologies and or Telecom domain a plus
  • Proficient in SQL / AWS Athena environment including the ability to write complex SQL queries, table joins and common table expressions (CTE)
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including formulas, pivot tables, and data analysis features
  • Proficiency in statistical methods, including hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and probability, to draw meaningful conclusions from data. Can identify important metrics and KPIs related for business and or WiFi technology performance
  • Knowledge of programming languages such as Python and R for statistical and data analysis a plus
  • Proficient with project lifecycles - Participates in projects from inception to end, working with project stakeholders to write detailed reporting requirements and deliver on reporting milestones during the project lifecycle
  • Proficient with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, Pivot or other reporting/visualization tools
  • Familiarity with Atlassian tools such as Jira and Confluence

Soft Skills:

  • Ability to work individually and in both small and large group settings which may include working cross functionally across the organization
  • Strong communication and presentation skills are necessary as we work closely with product owners and executive leadership
  • Strong organizational and time management skills required with ability to set prioritization and multitask to complete tasks on time

Education/Certifications

  • Bachelor's degree or commensurate experience necessary

Compensation

For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in Colorado, Sand Cherry Associates is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to the State of Colorado and takes into account a wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and delivery model. This is a 6 month consulting engagement, with an hourly range of $55-60/hour on 1099. Years of experience, level of education, geographic location, unique skills/qualifications for the specific role and potential certifications can be key factors in the final compensation for this role.

Benefits

Our team is unique — we are passionate about what we do. At Sand Cherry, our Consultants know they are impacting and shaping our clients' industries. We recognize our employees for their contributions. Our culture is one of the most friendly and communicative in the consulting industry. Sand Cherry is not a top-heavy organization. We offer the opportunity to be part of a digital workforce. Discover the experience that only comes with self-responsibility in the workplace. Our team members manage their own workloads and are expected to deliver exceptional work for our clients. Professional career growth is one of our main priorities, as we affirm that investing in our Consultants and empowering our people will also deliver the best results and value for our clients.

Title: Business Intelligence / Data Analyst
Description:
About Company:

A growing innovative FinTech, eCommerce company, which provides brand name durable goods to consumers on a lease-to-own (LTO) basis through its ecommerce marketplace and LTO payment method. It also provides LTO technology platforms to retailers and e-tailers to enter transactions with consumers who want to obtain durable goods, but do not have the available cash or credit.

We enjoy an accessible, fun, and fast-paced onsite work environment, where we collaborate with colleagues at all levels of the organization. We are creative and resolute initiative-takers who are comfortable working in a deadline-driven ever-changing startup environment.




Sponsorship Notice: Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.




This position is onsite, 5 days a week. Local candidates preferred.




Overview:

We are looking for a detail oriented, skilled and motivated Business Intelligence / Data Analyst with 3 to 5 years of experience to join our data-driven team. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in SQL, data analysis, and data visualization, with a passion for transforming data into actionable insights to support strategic decision-making.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain SQL queries, views, and functions to support reporting and analytics needs.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Build and maintain dashboards and reports using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Ensure data quality and integrity through validation checks and QA processes.
Work with large datasets to perform data analysis, identify trends, and generate insights.
Participate in performance tuning of queries and support improvements to data infrastructure.
Collaborate with team members using version control systems like Git to manage code changes.
Continuously improve reporting processes and documentation.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
3–5 years of hands-on experience in a BI Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role.
Strong SQL skills, including joint, aggregations, and analytical functions.
Experience in building and optimizing stored procedures and reusable data scripts.
Familiarity with data modeling and database design concepts.
Hands-on experience with at least one data visualization tool (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Exposure to version control systems such as Git
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Effective communicator with the ability to present findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working with cloud-based databases (e.g., AWS RDS, Google BigQuery, Azure SQL).
Basic knowledge of Python or R for data manipulation or analysis.
Familiarity with Agile or Scrum development methodologies.
Understanding of ETL processes and data pipeline concepts.
Comfortable in a fast paced startup environment, owning your deliverables
